alert.note: Alert for Butler; Clermont; Clinton; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER, NORTHEASTERN CLERMONT, WARREN AND CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 530 AM EDT... At 500 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Mason, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Mason, Lebanon, Sharonville, Wilmington, Monroe, Loveland, Blanchester, West Chester, Waynesville, Sabina, New Vienna, Morrow, Highpoint, Kings Island, Sixteen Mile Stand, Olde West Chester, Four Bridges, Wetherington, Brecon and South Lebanon. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 19 and 57. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for central, southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
